title: Image - Usage Examples
description: Common usage patterns and example configurations for the Image block

examples.name: Simple Responsive Image - Centered
examples.description: Basic centered image with responsive sizing and lazy loading
examples.visualDescription: Centered image, max-width 100% on mobile, auto on desktop, full size, smooth 0.3s transitions, lazy loading enabled
examples.useCase: Blog post images, product photos, general content images, hero images
examples.responsiveNotes: max-width scales down on smaller screens (800px → 600px → 100% on mobile)
examples.accessibilityNotes: Always set alt text on WordPress media when uploading images

examples.name: Linked Image with Hover Opacity Effect
examples.description: Clickable image that becomes slightly transparent on hover
examples.visualDescription: Full opacity normally, reduces to 85% opacity on hover with smooth 0.4s transition, opens in new tab
examples.useCase: Clickable banners, product thumbnails with links, call-to-action images, linked portfolio items
warnings: Don't set opacity too low on hover - images should remain clearly visible (minimum 0.6 recommended)
Always provide link context - users should know where the image link leads

examples.name: Grayscale to Color Hover Effect
examples.description: Image starts in grayscale, transitions to full color on hover
examples.visualDescription: 100% grayscale (black & white) normally, smoothly transitions to full color on hover over 0.5 seconds
examples.useCase: Team member photos, portfolio galleries, before/after effects, interactive galleries
warnings: Filter transitions may not work smoothly on older browsers (IE11, older Safari)
CPU-intensive filters (blur with high values) can cause performance issues on mobile

examples.name: Circular Profile Image with Border
examples.description: Perfectly circular image with colored border, ideal for avatars
examples.visualDescription: 200×200px circular image (50% border radius), 4px solid purple border, center aligned, slight shadow
examples.useCase: Author bios, team member avatars, user profiles, testimonial photos, comment avatars
examples.responsiveNotes: Image size reduces from 200px → 150px → 120px on smaller screens while maintaining perfect circle
warnings: For perfect circles, iWidth and iHeig must have identical values at each breakpoint
Use imgFit: 'cover' to prevent image distortion - crops to fill circle
Border radius in % creates circles only when width = height

examples.name: Image with Caption Below
examples.description: Image with styled caption text displayed below
examples.visualDescription: Image with gray caption text below (15px spacing), italic style, center-aligned caption, light gray background

attributes.ctmCap: Photo taken at sunrise in the Swiss Alps

examples.useCase: Photography portfolios, image credits, descriptive captions, educational content, art galleries
warnings: tiCap must not be 'none' for caption to display - use 'below' or other caption mode
ctmCap supports HTML - use sparingly (bold, italic, links only)
Caption styling (icapTypo, icapColor, etc.) only applies when tiCap is not 'none'

validationRules.tiCap: Must be set to a value other than 'none' (e.g., 'below') for caption to appear
validationRules.ctmCap: Required when tiCap is not 'none' - the actual caption text

examples.name: Card Image with Shadow and Rounded Corners
examples.description: Image styled as a card component with rounded corners and shadow
examples.visualDescription: 12px rounded corners, soft shadow (0 8px 16px), full-width on mobile, subtle hover shadow increase
examples.useCase: Blog post thumbnails, product cards, featured images, card-based layouts, grid galleries
examples.responsiveNotes: max-width 600px on desktop, 100% width on mobile for responsive card design

examples.name: Full-Width Hero Image with Object-Fit Cover
examples.description: Full-width hero image that maintains aspect ratio by cropping
examples.visualDescription: 100% width, 500px height on desktop (300px mobile), crops to fill container while maintaining aspect ratio, center-center object position
examples.useCase: Hero sections, full-width banners, page headers, background images with fixed height
warnings: imgFit: 'cover' will crop images - ensure important content is centered
Fixed height (iHeig) with 100% width requires object-fit to prevent distortion
Different heights per breakpoint (md/sm/xs) allow responsive hero sections

validationRules.imgFit: Use 'cover' when setting both width and height to prevent image distortion
validationRules.iWidth + iHeig: When both are set, object-fit determines how image fills space

examples.name: Advanced: Absolutely Positioned Decorative Image
examples.description: Image positioned absolutely for decorative overlays or floating elements
examples.visualDescription: Small decorative graphic (80px) positioned at top-right of parent container (20px from top, 30px from right), 50% opacity
examples.useCase: Decorative graphics, floating badges, corner embellishments, overlay elements, design accents
warnings: globalPosition: 'absolute' requires parent container to have position: relative
Absolutely positioned images don't affect document flow - can overlap other content
gloabhorizoOri and gloabverticalOri must be set before offsets work ('left'/'right' and 'top'/'bottom')
Consider disabling lazy load (dislazyLoad: true) for above-fold positioned images

validationRules.globalPosition: Must be 'absolute' or 'fixed' for offset positioning to work
validationRules.gloabhorizoOri: Required when using glohoriOffset - set to 'left' or 'right'
validationRules.gloabverticalOri: Required when using gloverticalOffset - set to 'top' or 'bottom'

commonMistakes: Setting offsets without setting globalPosition to 'absolute' or 'fixed'
Forgetting to set orientation (gloabhorizoOri/gloabverticalOri) before offsets
Not adding position: relative to parent container

circular_profile_image.description: Perfect circle image with equal width and height

validationRules.block_id: Required - unique identifier for the image block
validationRules.tImg: Required - image object containing url and Id from WordPress media library
validationRules.tImg.url: Required - full URL to the image file
validationRules.tImg.Id: Required - WordPress attachment ID (used for srcset and responsive images)
validationRules.iSize: Optional - WordPress image size (thumbnail/medium/large/full), defaults to 'full'
validationRules.tiCap: Required for captions - set to 'below' or caption mode (not 'none')
validationRules.ctmCap: Required when tiCap is not 'none' - the caption text content
validationRules.imgFit: Recommended when setting both iWidth and iHeig - use 'cover' or 'contain' to prevent distortion
validationRules.globalPosition: Must be 'absolute' or 'fixed' for positioning offsets to work
validationRules.gloabhorizoOri: Required with glohoriOffset - set to 'left' or 'right'
validationRules.gloabverticalOri: Required with gloverticalOffset - set to 'top' or 'bottom'

warnings: Never modify block_id after image creation - breaks references
tImg.Id must match actual WordPress attachment ID - incorrect ID breaks srcset
For perfect circles: iWidth and iHeig must be identical at each breakpoint
imgFit: 'cover' crops images - ensure important content is centered
Opacity values (inOpa, iHOpa) range from 0 (invisible) to 1 (fully visible)
Filter effects (blur, grayscale) can be CPU-intensive on mobile - test performance
Absolutely positioned images (globalPosition: 'absolute') require parent with position: relative
Caption styles (icapTypo, icapColor, etc.) only apply when tiCap is not 'none'
Lazy loading (dislazyLoad: false) is default - disable for above-fold images
Border radius in % creates circles only when width = height
Setting both iWidth and iHeig without imgFit can cause image distortion
commonMistakes: Setting caption attributes (icapTypo, icapColor) without changing tiCap from 'none'
Using iWidth and iHeig together without imgFit (causes distortion)
Setting border radius to 50% on non-square images (creates ovals, not circles)
Forgetting to set openFilter: true in inFilt/iHfilt before defining filter values
Using globalPosition without setting orientation (gloabhorizoOri/gloabverticalOri) first
Setting opacity too low (< 0.5) making images invisible or hard to see
Using lazy loading (dislazyLoad: false) on hero images above the fold (delays loading)
Not configuring responsive values for iWidth/iHeig on fixed-size images
Setting border (ibord) without openBorder: 1 (border won't display)
Using high blur values in filters on mobile (performance issues)
bestPractices: Always use WordPress media library for tImg - includes automatic srcset for responsive images
Set iSize to appropriate WordPress size ('large' for most content, 'full' for hero images)
Use imWidth (max-width) instead of iWidth for responsive images that scale down
Configure responsive values (md/sm/xs) for image sizes on different screen sizes
Use imgFit: 'cover' when setting fixed dimensions to prevent distortion
Keep opacity values above 0.6 for readability and accessibility
Use intran: '0.3' to '0.5' for smooth hover transitions (not too fast, not too slow)
For circular images: set equal width/height + 50% border radius + imgFit: 'cover'
Disable lazy loading (dislazyLoad: true) for above-fold images (faster LCP)
Use filters sparingly - grayscale and brightness are safest for performance
Always test absolutely positioned images on all breakpoints (may overlap on mobile)
Provide meaningful alt text via WordPress media library for accessibility

responsiveStrategy.description: Image block adapts to screen sizes using md (desktop), sm (tablet), xs (mobile) breakpoints
responsiveStrategy.recommendedApproach: Configure md first (desktop), then override sm/xs only where needed. Empty sm/xs values inherit from md.
commonResponsivePatterns: Use percentage widths on mobile for full-width images: iWidth md: '800px' → xs: '100%'
Reduce fixed heights on smaller screens: iHeig md: '500px' → sm: '400px' → xs: '300px'
Scale circular images down: iWidth/iHeig md: '200px' → sm: '150px' → xs: '120px'
Use max-width (imWidth) for images that should scale: imWidth md: '800px' → xs: '100%'
Center-align images on mobile even if left-aligned on desktop: tiAlign md: 'left' → xs: 'center'

accessibilityNotes: Alt text is managed via WordPress media library - always provide descriptive alt text when uploading
For decorative images, use empty alt text (alt='') - set in WordPress media library
Ensure sufficient color contrast for caption text (icapColor) - WCAG AA: 4.5:1 minimum
Linked images should have clear context - user should know where link leads
Don't rely solely on color filters to convey meaning (e.g., red filter = error)
For text embedded in images, provide equivalent text in caption or surrounding content
Test keyboard navigation for linked images - should be focusable and activatable

filterOptionsReference.description: CSS filter effects available in inFilt and iHfilt attributes

filters.grayscale: 0-100 - Converts image to grayscale (0 = color, 100 = black & white)
filters.blur: 0-20px - Applies Gaussian blur (higher = more blur, CPU-intensive)
filters.contrast: 0-200 - Adjusts contrast (100 = normal, < 100 = low contrast, > 100 = high contrast)
filters.saturate: 0-200 - Adjusts color saturation (0 = grayscale, 100 = normal, > 100 = vivid)
filters.sepia: 0-100 - Applies sepia tone (0 = none, 100 = full sepia)
filters.hue-rotate: 0-360deg - Rotates hue (shifts colors around color wheel)

usage.openFilter: Must be set to true before filter values are applied
usage.combining_filters: Multiple filters can be used together (e.g., grayscale + brightness)
usage.hover_effects: Use inFilt for normal state, iHfilt for hover state with different values
usage.performance: Blur is most CPU-intensive - use sparingly, especially on mobile

objectFitReference.description: How imgFit (object-fit) controls image scaling within container

values.cover: Image fills container completely, cropping if needed to maintain aspect ratio (recommended for fixed dimensions)
values.contain: Image fits entirely within container, may show letterboxing/pillarboxing to maintain aspect ratio
values.fill: Image stretches to fill container, ignoring aspect ratio (can cause distortion)
values.none: Image displays at natural size, may overflow or not fill container
values.scale-down: Shows image at smaller of 'none' or 'contain'

when_to_use.cover: Use when you want image to fill fixed dimensions without distortion (crops image)
when_to_use.contain: Use when you want entire image visible within fixed dimensions (may show gaps)
when_to_use.fill: Rarely used - causes distortion unless image matches container aspect ratio exactly
when_to_use.none: Use when you want image at natural size regardless of container

objectFitReference.note: Object-fit is most useful when both iWidth and iHeig are set to fixed values

lazyLoadingGuidance.description: When to disable lazy loading (dislazyLoad attribute)
lazyLoadingGuidance.default: dislazyLoad: false (lazy loading enabled by default)
disable_when: Image is above the fold (visible without scrolling) - improves LCP (Largest Contentful Paint)
Image is a hero/banner at top of page
Image is critical for initial page render
Image is used for absolutely positioned decorative elements that should load immediately
keep_enabled_when: Image is below the fold (not visible on initial load)
Image is in a gallery or grid with many images
Image is at bottom of long article
Page has many images (prioritize above-fold loading)
lazyLoadingGuidance.performance_note: Lazy loading improves initial page load time by deferring offscreen images. Disable only for critical above-fold images.
